verbs.description: [ARG0: slim majority] [V: opposes] [ARG1: ballot question on nurse staffing poll] finds a new poll suggests that support for a ballot question to regulate nurse staffing is waning with a slim majority of registered voters surveyed last week saying they plan to vote against the measure on election day fifty - one percent of likely voters said they opposed the ballot question while 43 percent supported it according to the new umass lowell boston globe poll that a reversal from a survey in september that found 52 percent of lynn sackman - aper supreme court co - director senator elizabeth warren university of massachusetts lowell radiation laboratory columbia gas poll university of massachusetts lowell shiva ayyadurai brett kavanaugh christine blasey ford us senate dudley geoff diehl charlie baker baseball umass massachusetts health hospital association nurse massachusetts nurses association massachusetts health hospital association marlborough joshua j dyck state health policy commission assault massachusetts judith stolfo governor charlie baker jay gonzalez us stephen turner joshua j dyck merrimack valley center for public opinion office administrator
